name: encounter_asteroids
title: ASTEROID FIELD DETECTED
content: Our short-range sensors have picked up an asteroid field nearby. Might be some useful minerals in there.

win.response: You send a scout ship with utility lasers to carve out some ore. Once they're done you process it into fuel!

fail.response: You send a scout ship to carve out some ore. A micrometeorite swipes it out of existence, taking the crew with it.

options.response: You leave the asteroids where they are. Can't risk damage to the ship.

name: encounter_radiation
title: ABNORMAL RADIATION READINGS
content: Science department is reporting unusual radiation levels on the planet below.

win.response: The scouts are gone for a long time. When they return, exhausted, they bring fifteen canisters of starship fuel!

fail.response: The landing craft enters the ionosphere and immediately loses contact. You wait for hours, but they don't return.

options.response: You broadcast a data packet in case it's of use to someone else. Time to move on.

name: encounter_micrometeorites
title: MICROMETEORITE BARRAGE
content: You can make out a sound like hail falling on a metal roof. Navigation Officer [SNAME_NAVIGATOR] says you've jumped right into a debris field.

win.response: [FNAME_PILOT] threads the needle, pulling you out of the path of the bigger fragments. You take a few hits, but the ship survives.

fail.response: [FNAME_PILOT] opens the throttle and tries to power through the field. A metal shard looms out of the darkness. [FNAME_PILOT] is fast, but not fast enough. You pull through. Barely.

options.response: Chief Engineer [SNAME_ENGINEER] diverts power to the emergency shield. It screeches into life and drains the fuel cells. The storm continues, but the hull holds.

name: encounter_fight
title: ASSAULT ON BOARD
content: Head of Security [SNAME_SECURITY] takes you aside at breakfast. A junior engineer has seriously assaulted a colleague. There is no brig on board.

win.response: [SNAME_SECURITY] nods and immediately leaves the mess hall. It's a hard decision, but you can't tolerate violence onboard.

fail.response: [SNAME_SECURITY] leaves and, the next day, brings you the report of the incident. The perpetrator made a scene. Everyone knows.

options.response: [SNAME_SECURITY] doesn't seem happy about it, but talks to the victim and convinces them to keep quiet. You transfer him to another department.
